To begin, give each player five letter tiles from the tin. Next, place 15 tiles face up on the table. This is the letter pool.
Question cards come in two levels of difficulty.
Read a card, which everyone plays. Each player must now take turns to try and spell one of the answers to the question.
Need more letters? Take a letter directly from the letter pool...
or grab two tiles from the tin. The first goes into the pool, the second into your pile. The first player to spell an answer correctly wins those letters and adds them their stack of tiles.
The first player whose stack passes the winning line on the tin is the champ.

Begin with a terrifying Doom Card.
You and your friends are now (unfortunately) in this situation.
Fear not. Each player is given some Object Cards.
Use one of your Object Cards to engineer the best escape imaginable
Example:
Player 1 decides to use their "Duck Whistle", summoning a flock of space geese to wreak havoc on the UFO, allowing for a speedy getaway.

After everyone's told their escape plan you vote for the funniest. Most votes wins the Doom Card.

Restock your Object Cards and escape a new scenario.

First to three Doom Cards wins.
This is a seriously simple but madly addictive travel rile game. You can teach anyone from around the world to play it in 20 seconds even if you can\'t speak a word of their language.
First, grab a stack of tiles. Now place a tile on the table. The next player can put their tile next player can put their tile next to any flat side of your tile. but not at the corner.
The first player to make a horizontal, vertical or diagonal line of 5 wins.
If you run out of tiles, you can reposition one of your tiles until you get a winner.
One person plays Mr Lister, the rest split into two posses. Mr Lister reads out a question.
The first team fire off an answer. If they hit a correct answer, they score a hit. If they miss they get zilch.
The second team now blast off an answer. Hit and they score. Miss and they get nada.
Each team gets three shots in total. The team with the most hits, wins the card and the drink on the back.
Win five different drinks to win the game.
If the two teams tie after three shots, they go through to the Last Chance Saloon.
Mr Lister reads the impossible question and the team nearest the correct answer wins the card.
